de.mrapp.android.adapter.list.enablestate

Class AbstractEnableStateListAdapter<DataType,DecoratorType extends AbstractListDecorator<DataType>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<de.mrapp.android.util.view.ViewHolder>
      • de.mrapp.android.adapter.list.AbstractListAdapter<DataType,DecoratorType>
        • de.mrapp.android.adapter.list.enablestate.AbstractEnableStateListAdapter<DataType,DecoratorType>
  • Type Parameters:
    DataType - The type of the adapter's underlying data
    DecoratorType - The type of the decorator, which allows to customize the appearance of the views, which are used to visualize the items of the adapter
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.widget.Adapter, android.widget.ListAdapter, DataStructure, Parameterizable, Restorable, EnableStateListAdapter<DataType>, FilterableListAdapter<DataType>, ItemStateListAdapter<DataType>, SortableListAdapter<DataType>, Loggable, RecyclerViewAdapter, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractItemStateListAdapter

    public abstract class AbstractEnableStateListAdapter<DataType,DecoratorType extends AbstractListDecorator<DataType>>
extends AbstractListAdapter<DataType,DecoratorType>
implements EnableStateListAdapter<DataType>
    An abstract base class for all adapters, whose underlying data is managed as a list of arbitrary items, which may be disabled or enabled. Such an adapter's purpose is to provide the underlying data for visualization using a AbsListView widget.
    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractEnableStateListAdapter

        protected AbstractEnableStateListAdapter(@NonNull
                                         android.content.Context context,
                                         @NonNull
                                         DecoratorType decorator,
                                         @NonNull
                                         de.mrapp.android.util.logging.LogLevel logLevel,
                                         @NonNull
                                         java.util.ArrayList<Item<DataType>> items,
                                         boolean allowDuplicates,
                                         boolean notifyOnChange,
                                         @NonNull
                                         java.util.Set<ListAdapterItemClickListener<DataType>> itemClickListeners,
                                         @NonNull
                                         java.util.Set<ListAdapterItemLongClickListener<DataType>> itemLongClickListeners,
                                         @NonNull
                                         java.util.Set<ListAdapterListener<DataType>> adapterListeners,
                                         @NonNull
                                         java.util.Set<ListEnableStateListener<DataType>> enableStateListeners)
        Creates a new adapter, whose underlying data is managed as a list of arbitrary items, which may be disabled or enabled.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, the adapter should belong to, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        decorator - The decorator, which should be used to customize the appearance of the views, which are used to visualize the items of the adapter, as an instance of the generic type DecoratorType. The decorator may not be null
        logLevel - The log level, which should be used for logging, as a value of the enum LogLevel. The log level may not be null
        items - A list, which contains the adapter's items, or an empty list, if the adapter should not contain any items
        allowDuplicates - True, if duplicate items should be allowed, false otherwise
        notifyOnChange - True, if the method notifyDataSetChanged():void should be automatically called when the adapter's underlying data has been changed, false otherwise
        itemClickListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when an item of the adapter has been clicked by the user, as an instance of the type Set or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        itemLongClickListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when an item of the adapter has been long-clicked by the user, as an instance of the type Set or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        adapterListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when the adapter's underlying data has been modified or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        enableStateListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when an item has been disabled or enabled or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified

        protected final java.util.Set<ListEnableStateListener<DataType>> getEnableStateListeners()
        Returns a set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when an item has been disabled or enabled.

        A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when an item has been disabled or enabled, as an instance of the type Set or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified

        Parameters:

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • triggerEnableState

        public final boolean triggerEnableState(int index)
        Description copied from interface: EnableStateListAdapter
        Triggers the enable state of the item, which belongs to a specific index. This causes the item to become disabled, if it is currently enabled and vice versa.
        Specified by:
        triggerEnableState in interface EnableStateListAdapter<DataType>
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the item, whose enable state should be triggered, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the item has been enabled, false, if the item has been disabled

      • triggerEnableState

        public final boolean triggerEnableState(@NonNull
                                        DataType item)
        Description copied from interface: EnableStateListAdapter
        Triggers the enable state of a specific item. This causes the item to become disabled, if it is currently enabled and vice versa.
        Specified by:
        triggerEnableState in interface EnableStateListAdapter<DataType>
        Parameters:
        item - The item, whose enable state should be triggered, as an instance of the generic type DataType. The item may not be null. If the item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the item has been enabled, false, if the item has been disabled
